channel.title: Online
channel.description: hey guys i have been working on a rsps for a while(1-2weeks) and i came to the point before 2 days that i must make it online so i followed tons of tutorials (no-ip,portforwoding...and others) but the problem is that i don't know where exactly to add my no-ip and how exactly i can share my rsps so others can play my game so if anyone got any information that can help pleas help me . thank you.

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @elias_haddad elias haddad
item.description:
@elias_haddad wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:16, topic:540524”][quote author=elias haddad link=topic=659386.msg4410383#msg4410383 date=1393417620]

can i use java file deleter (on a client file copy) then i send it?
[/quote]

I have no idea what you mean by this.

In regards to the server ip issue… if you are hosting the server via local host(Your computer) then YOUR copy of the client’s ip needs to be 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
everyone else’s client’s needs to have your no-ip ip[/quote]
idk it didn’t work i tried

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

elias haddad:

can i use java file deleter (on a client file copy) then i send it?

I have no idea what you mean by this.

In regards to the server ip issue… if you are hosting the server via local host(Your computer) then YOUR copy of the client’s ip needs to be 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
everyone else’s client’s needs to have your no-ip ip

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @elias_haddad elias haddad
item.description:
@elias_haddad wrote:

Devinhdl:

You just compile it, and zip the client using winrar… Or you could jar the client… Then just upload it to mediafire or something and send your friends the link so that they can download it

can i use java file deleter (on a client file copy) then i send it?

Edite: i changed serverip= to the ip addres of no-ip but i got error connecting to server when i try to log in why ? what should i do?

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

You just compile it, and zip the client using winrar… Or you could jar the client… Then just upload it to mediafire or something and send your friends the link so that they can download it

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @elias_haddad elias haddad
item.description:
@elias_haddad wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:540524”][quote author=elias haddad link=topic=659386.msg4409965#msg4409965 date=1393262211]

Only client mate… in basic terms, i guess you could say that the source’s ip updates to whatever ip hosts it. By host, I mean the ip that is running the server. just make the client connect to the hosting ip and you will be set.

I syaed tht cause there is a no-ip domain in clint.java (source )so i thought it need to be changed to my own domain
[/quote]
I’d change it in the source too just in case.[/quote]
ow ok thank you (both) for helping me i will do this when i get back from my trip
and when i change the ip addres and domain how i can send my game to others to join?

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

The source files, stay on the hosting computer, or your computer. The client files hold the ip (no-ip) and gets distributed to the community. SO if you’ve portforwarded, opened your ports and all that jazz, put your ip(no-ip) in the client’s files… ex: client.java, sometimes gui.java and jframe.java, depending on the client.
Just search “server =” in your client files and change the ip…

Read full topic
